insurer_name: Aviva Insurance Limited (underwritten by Prestige Underwriting Services Limited on behalf of Aviva Insurance Limited, administered by Pikl Insurance Services Limited)
policy_type: Property Host Insurance (Short Term Letting/Holiday Rental)
coverage_summary: This policy provides cover for incidents which may arise when you have short term guests at the insured property. It covers buildings, contents, loss of income, electric vehicle charging units, legal liability, and legal expenses related to hosting activities.
key_inclusions: Buildings: Fire, explosion, and smoke damage
Buildings: Accidental or malicious damage
Buildings: Escape of water or oil
Buildings: Theft or attempted theft
Buildings: Emergency services damage
Buildings: Alternative accommodation and kennelling
Contents: Fire, explosion, and smoke damage
Contents: Accidental or malicious damage
Contents: Escape of water or oil
Contents: Theft or attempted theft
Contents: Loss of keys and replacement locks
Contents: Emergency services damage
Contents: Infestation of pests
Contents: Fatal injury
Loss of income following a claim
Electric and Hybrid Home Charging Units: Accidental or malicious damage
Electric and Hybrid Home Charging Units: Theft
Legal Liability: Liability for loss of, or damage to third party property, or for bodily injury
Legal Expenses: Legal expenses to defend or pursue legal claims arising from hosting activities
Legal Expenses: Eviction of overstaying guests
Legal Expenses: Defence for HMRC investigations relating to hosting activity
Legal Expenses: Legal support for social media defamation
key_exclusions: Claims not arising from hosting activity and a valid booking
Loss or damage caused by the host or a member of the hosts family
Loss or damage covered under a standard property policy
Loss or damage which occurs gradually over a period of time
Loss or damage caused by mechanical or electrical breakdown
Loss or damage to money and credit cards
Loss or liability of any kind involving Covid-19 or any communicable disease
Any loss of income incurred in the immediate 14 days after the insured event
Loss or damage to valuables and electrical valuables where the replacement value of a single article exceeds £5,000
Valuables and electrical valuables left in outbuildings, garages and the open
Laptops, tablets, and phones not kept in a locked room and out of sight when left unattended

coverage_limits.buildings_section_a_fire_smoke_explosion: £1,000,000 (applies where property is not a flat or apartment structure)
coverage_limits.buildings_section_b_fire_smoke_explosion: £50,000 (applies where property is a flat or apartment structure)
coverage_limits.buildings_section_a_accidental_malicious: £80,000 (applies where property is not a flat or apartment structure)
coverage_limits.buildings_section_b_accidental_malicious: £50,000 (applies where property is a flat or apartment structure)

special_conditions: Laptops, tablets, and phones must be kept in a locked room and out of sight when left unattended
Valuables and electrical valuables are not covered if they are left in outbuildings, garages and the open
You must ensure you comply with all the eligibility criteria within the policy wording and/or schedule
You must ensure a written agreement is in place with the guest, setting out the terms of the hosting activity
The property must be kept in a good state of repair and free from any tripping hazards
Reasonable care must be taken to protect the insured property against damage and to prevent accident or injury
The host must comply with all fire safety regulations and have a valid gas safety certificate in place
You must follow our claims process which can be found in your policy documentation
You must notify Pikl Insurance Services if any of this information is incorrect

common_questions.question: Does this policy cover me if I live in the property full-time?
common_questions.answer: No, this policy specifically covers incidents arising from hosting activity with short term guests. Claims not arising from hosting activity and a valid booking are excluded.

common_questions.question: If my guest damages something, is there a waiting period before I can claim loss of income?
common_questions.answer: Yes, any loss of income incurred in the immediate 14 days after the insured event is not covered.

common_questions.question: Can I leave my laptop out for guests to use?
common_questions.answer: Laptops, tablets, and phones must be kept in a locked room and out of sight when left unattended, otherwise they are not covered.

common_questions.question: Does this policy cover Covid-19 related claims?
common_questions.answer: No, loss or liability of any kind involving Covid-19 or any communicable disease is excluded.

common_questions.question: What if I have expensive jewelry worth £10,000 - is it fully covered?
common_questions.answer: No, loss or damage to valuables where the replacement value of a single article exceeds £5,000 has restrictions. Individual items over £5,000 are not fully covered under standard limits.

common_questions.question: Can I get a refund if I cancel after 3 months?
common_questions.answer: No, if you cancel after the 14-day cooling off period, there will be no refund due.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract

common_questions.question: Does this replace my standard home insurance?
common_questions.answer: No, this policy specifically excludes loss or damage covered under a standard property policy. This is supplementary cover for hosting activities.

common_questions.question: Do I need a written agreement with my guests?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you must ensure a written agreement is in place with the guest, setting out the terms of the hosting activity. This is a policy obligation.

common_questions.question: Is my property in Scotland covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, coverage extends to properties within the United Kingdom, including Northern Ireland and Scotland.

common_questions.question: Does this cover professional cleaning costs?
common_questions.answer: No, professional and domestic cleaning is specifically excluded from coverage.
